WRITING.TEXT: Bree is an Irish name meaning power or strength or something like that. All their name meaning were described it at the beginning of the episode where Susan and Mike were naming MJ

WRITING.TITLE: Why is Lynette accused of emasculating Tom whenever she tries to stop him making stupid decisions?
WRITING.TEXT: It's a constant theme that Lynette "emasculates" Tom. But seriously, all I see is her giving reasonable arguments to decisions that could potentially affect their family in a bad way. The pizza place almost ruined them, and Lynette was just offering logical advice beforehand to yet another of his random mid-life crisises. I thought married couples were supposed to discuss life changing decisions, but whenever she tries to have a say on things that will affect her and her children, she's accused of being a ball breaker. It's like Tom is a petulant child with an inferiority complex, who'd risk everything to prove a point to his much more sensible wife.
I get your point, but if he's a bartender it could well be a club. Just sayin'.

Couldn't help but laugh when the sky is swarming with man-eating pterodactyls, and the bad guy decides it's a good idea to go and stand on the roof to revel in his evilness. Like, how wasn't he eaten? Or am a I missing something?

I studied forensic neuropsychology, and I agree there someone can be a paedophile (harbouring an unhealthy sexual desire of children) but not a child molester (a paedophile who acts on said desires). Those of the latter deserve to be hung, drawn and quartered.

WRITING.TITLE: I like reading spoilers to series/movies before I've finished them.
WRITING.TEXT: Maybe I'm just impatient.
Probably because the majority of Americans are overweight. Fat chicks (and blokes, mind you) tend to have bigger jugs.
My boyfriend works in construction and brought aload of industrial style earplugs for me to use. They work like a charm. I kinda find the silent vibrations in the bed soothing, but that's just me.

WRITING.TITLE: Fat people should have to pay more for their clothes.
WRITING.TEXT: It's more material afterall, right? The price of children's clothes increases with the age, so surely this should apply to adult sizes. It might also deter larger women from buying clothes that are 'in', but no way suit their body type, thus saving the public some unsavoury sights.
They don't in the UK. Highstreet shops cater for plus size without a price compromise.
My sister getting in a relationship with my ex a couple of days after our other sister committed suicide.
Also, my cat sabbotaging my breakfast by secretly peeing in the toaster. Burning feline urine is is not an ideal smell in the morning.
It was about 8 years ago. They're still together now with baby number two on the way, so all is forgiven now :) felt pretty crappy at the time though.

It took a while to forgive, but I had already lost one sister as well as my father in the same way 5 years prior. I tend to try and avoid stress as much as possible (understandably so), and family life is much easier in the absence of grudges.

You're not bursting a bubble, I kinda cottoned on that they must have been in contact beforehand. She just decided to approach me about it at that time of vulnerability. Maybe on some level, she was trying to replace the suicide with an issue that might be easier to deal with emotionally. But it all worked out in the end, and I'm honestly glad they're happy together.

WRITING.TITLE: Redditors who have been in inpatient mental health services - what makes a good support worker?

WRITING.TEXT: I'm sorry to hear that. If you don't mind me asking, what would you consider as 'equipped'? What sort of attributes/abilities do you think would be more helpful towards your recovery? You don't have to answer here if you don't feel comfortable, of course. I really appreciate your input.
I don't think a physical gift is necessary. The best apology is one with sincerity and understanding of the wrong-doing at hand.

Absolutely. I'm in no way trying to come across as selfish, or articulate that I was the only one suffering. The thread was about when you've felt most betrayed, and at this point, I did. It was both of us against the world when our father committed suicide, so I thought we'd have each other's back that time. Back then it was selfish and ignorant to think of it as a triple rejection, as opposed to supporting her pain and outlets of that, regardless. It's hard in the moment, which is why I find that time facilitates reflection, which in turn allows you to consider the actions of others.

When people/children are exposed to suicide, it becomes a reality, rather than something people just talk about. It's a taboo that suddenly becomes accessible, or something that can be done. Stats show that familial suicides cause consequential ones. My father's inquest deemed him of sound mind with his, but my sister was declared too intoxicated and a 'cry for help'. Unfortunately, her boyfriend killed himself too a year later. It's a sad residual effect.
Well they do, usually. But as I said, as the age goes up, the price does too with kids clothes.
This is a really good point. Sometimes you need someone to replace a distorted point of view.
Why goats, specifically? In any scenario.
As much as I like goats, I'm pretty sure they're herbivores.
Completely went over my head

It was alien to me, so I didn't comprehend the effects it would have. Long story short - I was handed vodka in a car park, drank said vodka, and a few hours later my ma answered the door to two policemen holdong me up, (in her irish terms), "like Jesus on a cross". Start slowly, my friend, and be conscious of how it's affecting you at the time.
Could you be more specific, please? I'm new
Well that sounds like a sticky situation..

I had it a lot whilst at uni, including hallucinations. The worst was when I couldn't move, but I could see a figure crouched over the desk at the bottom of my bed. It turned it's head, and all I could see was a sinister dark figure with bright red eyes looking at me. Absolutely terrifying.
Game of Thrones
Lazarus
Constant selfies and seeking validation from social media.
Drink
I'd ask my dad whether he realised the damage his suicide would cause, and why he had to leave me here.
Undergrad was absolutely useless on it's own. I found employers much prefer experience. Got a placement on my Master's and got a job soon after graduating.

It depends on the course and your ambitions. My UG was Psychology, so to pursue that I definitely needed a postgrad and valuable experience. A Masters also tends to bump your CV up the queue a bit, regardless.
Trees
This one time, I was at a wedding with a free bar and actually left on my own feet (as opposed to being carried out).
To watch us unnecessarily destroy our own resources
Agree with Harry Potter. The overuse of adjectives is just annoying.
My boyfriend was constantly playimg Stormzy's first youtube video before he became a thing

Have you considered it could be your ego that leads you to believe these unavailable women 'try so hard', when they're actually just interacting with you? Do you feel the same with unnattractive women who are also unavailable? Turn of a coin though, some unavailable people still like to gain attention from others they find attractive, for their own ego - without any intention of wrongdoing. Maybe to validate that they are still desirable? Or maybe you just find yourself interacting with assholes?
The intention of a remark/gesture, and consideration of the person it's directed at. Always be tactful, respectful, and non-judgemental in the approach.
I think you're over-analysing your interactions with girls now you've lost weight. Congrats btw (that's not a come on).
Very unpopular

That I still help support my mother in little ways (bills, chores, emotional support), despite not living with her. I truly appreciate and respect my mother's kindness, whereas all my siblings take advantage of it. I don't want acknowledgement, I just wish they'd realise I'll always be there for my ma, no matter what, and to appreciate that - put their selfishness aside, and act like they care so I don't feel I have to hold up the fort on my own. It'd be nice to catch a break without worrying I'm the only one who gives a damn.
I don't think people cared. We're now a society of people who can't be appreciate what we've got, and constantly seek something better. Appreciate that bread.
All of the wine (after a 14 hour shift).
Potatoes and dumplings?

Growing up as a totally normal family, being particularly close with my dad. His suicide at our home leading to multiple other suicides in the immediate family and mental health issues. The rest of the family still suffer so much in that respect. I've coped by my favourite quote, "worst things happen at sea". I've never been to sea, of course, but I see problems of today so trivial in comparison. The day my father went, part of me left too. I would hate for anyone to feel that pain, so making people happy is somewhat restorative for me.
Dramatic beaver
In what resepect?

I completely concur. I used to promote bands of the rock genre - heavy metal owns my heart - but going to festivals has just never appealed to me. I think music can be a personal thing, not just in the creation of it, but in the way people enjoy it. I'm glad I'm not the only one.

Your ma is lucky she has someone who cares in the best possible way they can. It may be out of place to say, but she'd be proud that you have modest and mature concern, and actively try to aleviate her struggles with no thought of a gain towards yourself. Did you have an answer to your own question?
Bitch about people you obviously don't know,but they know, but you'll be working in close vicinity of.
That's so kind. Thank you

I work in mental health rehab now in an inpatient facility. The clients stories can be both so sad but watching the rehabilitations are inspirational. I can't begin to imagine the world from their eyes, but seeing them day to day trying so hard to get better highlights the strength people with mental health issues have in accepting who they are, and I admire them for that. Sorry for the word spew.

Dementia is so heart breaking for all involved. What kind of dementia? Have you thought about putting things towards a memory box when she's having a good day? Music she liked in her youth, pictures, pop groups, places she/you both visited. I did an advocacy program here for people with dementia (early stages), and these boxes really helped with both parties. Mainly though, I've found songs to be the most profound thing in relaxing the horrible anxiety of dementia. Find something she used to love in her teens. Respect that it's a degenerative disease, amd will get worse. Just find ways to make her feel better and more comfortable. She's lucky to have someone like you who cares. And that's the most important thing. My heart goes out to you all.
Stairs
Anything rich in magnesium.
Beans, fish, almonds, dark green veg. Lots of stuff.
Although I found supplements most effective
Love your children. Let them know that being introverted is not a negative thing. They look up to you and inherit your personal traits, so own them
Over explaining things. When I say, "ahhhh yeah, I understand now", I don't mean, "please do provide me with five more different explanations of the same thing".
I fantasize about going to bed all day, so usually just relish in finally getting there.

WRITING.TITLE: I feel like I've finally woken up and can't believe what I've done to myself.
WRITING.TEXT: How do you deal with it all when you suddenly realise the damage you've done to yourself? I don't really care what other people think. It's been years, and I'm used to the looks. I just want the scars to go away, because they make me feel as though there was some hateful and insidious person hijacking my mind and body for so long. How do you accept it in yourself? After the temptations fad away, how do you rid yourself of the shame?
All depends on age and interests at the time. When I was growing up, it was Little House on the Prairie. Now it's The Jigsaw Man by Paul Britton.
Did you make a wish with the fallen eyelash?
Wtf is wrong with you?
I mean with this generation
If you can, get some magnesium supplements and make sure you eat loads beforehand.

I found my first few times, the biggest bitch was the damage from the gurning. So yeah, magnesium a few hours before and plenty of chewing gum during. The eating thing is just because your appetite is so suppressed, and you may not be able to eat the next day, so it's like preparing for a potential fast. Your body takes so much longer to recover with no sustainance.
Fit Water by Lucozade

I think ugly has a different meaning for animals compared to humans. Has anyone heard the phrase, "n'awwww, he's so ugly, he's cute!" when a weird looking dog comes into the room? Funny thought though - when someone describes a dog as ugly, it's purely the dog's appearance they're talking about. Whereas if someone says a person is ugly, it could mean their face, actions, intentions, personality, etc.
It's just supposed to be comical
Ugh, having tattoos has become so generic these days.
Kindness
A guy's height
Getting home after a 14 hour shift :)
A master's degree

A reporter turned up to my sister's inquest after she committed suicide. Suspicions were raised about a pregnancy termination that were refuted by her GP. The reporter completely ignored this and reported in a national newspaper that she killed herself after having an abortion. Eight years on and they still refuse to retract the article despite the facts. There were real issues leading to her suicide that should have been highlighted.
It's not necessarily the individual's fault they're poor.
I usually opt for three 13 hour shifts a week and get four days off. It's so nice to get a full time wage and all those days off.
Learn to enjoy your own company.

It depends on your reasoning. Morbid curiosity is just natural I think. I used to look at it daily when some pretty terrible stuff happened in my life. Sounds weird, but it was a reminder that there were people out there suffering way more than I was. Stopped me spiralling into a world of self pity, and blaming my actions on traumatic events.
Cream 'n' cheesy nik naks :(
The dog dying in I Am Legend
Alone time
I'm a female, and that's news to me.

I've found this (for me) comes down to how different genders are used to conflict. As in females are used to saying something to other females and being reassured with a negative sandwich. I've found men to be much more forthright, and women just don't wanna hear the honest truth at times of heightened emotion (eg you're being an irrational biatch right now). I've always had people tiptoe around me because of emotional traumas in my life, but the guy I'm with knows everything and isn't afraid to call me on my bullshit. Infuriating at the time, but gains a lot of respect.
Totally right. You shouldn't ever assume that someon's way of communicating is a personal attack on you. Everyone's different.

Girls tend to enjoy congregating and discussing another friend who isn't there, and coming to a conclusion about said absent friend. They then come to a satisfied unconfirmed conclusion and feel as though they've been a good friend. Whereas they could just talk to the person and find out what's up themselves.
"When in Rome". It just tends to happen. Muscle memory, maybe?
So raw and so relatable. With all due respect, I'm glad I'm not alone.

I think that's the problem - "trying" to own them. It's a major battle that isn't considered after the acute stage of self harm. Someone who stops cutting (or other whichways they harm) seems to be left with no recovery, no relapse minimalization, and no coping strategies. Your reply was very helpful. Thank you for being so relatable.

WRITING.TITLE: How far was too far?
WRITING.TEXT: Four months ago was the last time I self harmed. I stabbed myself in the leg three times with a kitchen knife. Where did that jump from razorblade stiches to actually stabbing myself come from? I'm totally torn between new physical boundaries self harm me wants to explore, and fear of what I could do if I relapse. Did anyone have a point where "enough was enough"? How did you cope? Please?
I've looked back at some of my self harm diaries, and this was a common theme.
